refbody.section: PurposeCopy a file to a remote location from the appliance.

dlentry.dd:
Uniform resource locator that is specified in one of the two following formats. In the following formats, white space is added only for readability. Do not include any white space in the URL on the command line.
For HTTP and FTP protocols, type the following command on the command line:
protocol: // [username [:password] @]hostname [:port]/[abspath/][relpath /] filename
where
protocol ftp or http
username User name at the remote host.
password Password for username at the remote host.
hostname Remote host name or IP address.
port Decimal port number of the remote server.
abspath Absolute path for the remote file. It is supported for protocol FTP and SCP.
relpath Relative path for the remote file. This path is relative to the default directory on the remote system. If username is specified, the default directory is typically the home directory of that user.
filename Remote file name.
For SCP protocol, type the following command on the command line:
protocol: // username@hostname : [/abspath/][relpath /] filename
where
protocol scp
username User name at the remote host.
hostname Remote host name or IP address. Host names that resolve to IPv6 addresses are supported. Literal IPv6 addresses, which contain colons, are not supported because the hostname is separated from the file path with a colon.
abspath Absolute path for the remote file. It is supported for protocol FTP and SCP.
relpath Relative path for the remote file. This path is relative to the default directory on the remote system. If username is specified, the default directory is typically the home directory of that user.
filename Remote file name.

ul.li: If your file put fails, it might be because the public key of the remote machine has changed. Use the user known-hosts list command to list the known hosts for the current user. Use the user known-hosts delete command to delete the public key that is stored for a known host so that new key can be learned.
Once a FILE is PUT, it remains in the staging area until it is used in a POST. A POST moves the file from the staging area /tmp/userfiles/ to /var/messagesight/data/certificates/.

section.title: Related Commands
section.p: See user known-hosts delete, and user known-hosts list

refbody.section: ExampleCopy local file collect-pd.txt to a remote system as diag.txt. file put collect-pd.txt scp://user1@example.com:~/diag.txt user1@example.com's password: collect-pd.txt 100% 101KB 101.4KB/s 00:00
Information for consumers onlyThe file commands operate on files in the /tmp/userfiles/ directory.
